title: Do rollups actually scale Ethereum or are we fooling ourselves? - Blockworks
summary: In an interview with Blockworks, Jon Charbonneau, co-founder and partner at DBA, a crypto investment firm, discusses the concept of rollups in the context of scaling Ethereum. Charbonneau defines a rollup as a state derived from data posted on another blockchain, which can be used to run a state transition function. He emphasizes that a rollup doesn't necessarily need to bridge back to the original data layer, as long as it uses the base network for security properties. Charbonneau admits that the question of whether rollups actually scale Ethereum is complex and difficult to answer, as it depends on how one defines scaling. He suggests that rollups can create more efficient execution environments that do more throughput for comparable resources, but notes that the answer lies within a "fuzzy line." Ultimately, scaling with rollups on Ethereum means using the properties of the underlying system in some way and retaining security properties, while also allowing for more interesting things to be done with ether.

The transition from MATIC to POL is part of Polygon's 2.0 plans to become the "value layer" of the internet. title: Polygon Deploys POL Token On Ethereum - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Polygon has launched its POL token on the Ethereum mainnet, marking a significant milestone in its ongoing "2.0" overhaul. The POL token will power Polygon's new staking layer, which will enable restaking across multiple Polygon chains, allowing validators to secure multiple chains with a single token. This upgrade aims to consolidate and unify Polygon's various scaling solutions into an interconnected ecosystem. The launch follows months of development and a successful testnet deployment, and Polygon plans to enable migrations from its existing MATIC token to POL by the end of the year.

title: Polygon POL Token Upgrade Goes Live on Ethereum Mainnet - The Crypto Basic
summary: Polygon POL token upgrade goes live on Ethereum mainnet. POL will replace MATIC as Polygon's native token and power multiple blockchains through a native re-staking protocol. Holders can perform various roles on each ZK-based L2 chain, including data availability committees, sequencing, and ZK proof generation. The upgrade is part of the Polygon 2.0 roadmap and will take up to four years or more. Users will be given ample time for the upgrade and will receive an equivalent amount of POL in return for sending MATIC to the upgraded contract.

title: MultiverseX in-car VR ecosystem Holoride bridges to Ethereum - Blockchain Gamer
summary: Holoride, an in-car VR ecosystem, has launched a cross-chain bridge connecting its platform MultiverseX to Ethereum. This allows users to transfer assets between the two blockchains. Holders of RIDE tokens on MultiverseX can now stake, trade, and store their tokens and NFTs on either blockchain. The move aims to provide more freedom for users and expand the reach of Holoride's ecosystem. The platform offers virtual reality experiences, including streaming, educational content, and games, and aims to create a sustainable ecosystem through its utility token RIDE. Recently, Holoride launched an NFT collection and partnered with XOXNO, a MultiverseX native NFT marketplace.

title: Ethereum Validator Queues for Entry and Exit Positions Drop to New Record Lows: Report - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum validator queues for entry and exit positions have reached new record lows, signaling a decrease in investor demand for Ether staking. The Validator Queues report showed that there were only a few validators in the queue, with an average wait time of zero minutes, compared to 45 days and 22 hours earlier this year. This decrease in demand is impacting the broader staking landscape. Despite the slump in staking rewards, the number of active validators on the Ethereum network has increased, with 861,938 validators currently staking 22.79% of the cryptocurrency's supply.

title: Polygon Deploys New POL Token Contracts on Ethereum - Decrypt

The new token is expected to play a critical role in the network's wider upgrade, which includes securing different use-case specific networks with staking rewards and transaction fees across compatible chains. The roadmap also includes moving the PoS chain to a pure-play zkRollup and introducing a new interoperability standard for its various chains.

summary: Polygon Labs (MATIC) is upgrading to Polygon 2.0, with the new POL token replacing MATIC on the Ethereum mainnet. The upgrade includes a new staking layer, transition to zkRollup, and ZK-powered interoperability protocol. MATIC holders have four years to migrate their holdings to the new token. This development comes after approved Polygon Improvement Proposals in September detailed POL token specifications. POL will power a vast ecosystem of zero-knowledge-based Layer 2 chains, allowing POL holders to validate multiple chains and perform multiple roles on each chain. title: Contango brings cPerps to Polygon PoS and Ethereum, reaching $2.4B liquidity - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Contango, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, has launched on Polygon PoS and Ethereum, expanding its liquidity to $2.4B. Contango builds perps (perpetual instruments) on top of money markets, without an order book or liquidity pools. The platform leverages Aave as the underlying money market, which currently totals $2.4B in liquidity across multiple chains. Traders can now benefit from greater liquidity on layer 1 (L1) and cheap fees and fast transactions on layer 2 (L2) networks. The design behind Contango is scalable and aims to integrate with more markets within the same chains, as well as with other DeFi protocols such as Compound, Spark, MakerDAO, and Morpho.

title: Polygon launches POL token contract on Ethereum to eventually replace MATIC - Cointelegraph
summary: Polygon Labs has launched a new token contract, POL, on Ethereum to replace its current token, MATIC. The new token is intended to power a vast ecosystem of zero-knowledge-based Layer 2 chains. According to the team, users do not need to exchange their MATIC for POL at present, as staking on both Polygon PoS and Polygon zkEVM is still being performed via the old token. The launch of POL will pave the way for other aspects of the Polygon 2.0 roadmap to be implemented, including the launch of a new staking layer, upgrading the current PoS network to zkEVM layer-2, and creating a shared liquidity protocol for all Polygon networks.

title: POL Token: Polygon's POL Token Contracts Goes Live On Ethereum - CoinGape
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Polygon Labs has announced that the POL token upgrade is now live on the Ethereum mainnet as part of the Polygon 2.0 roadmap. The POL token will replace the MATIC token as the ecosystem's native token and power all Polygon networks, including the main Polygon blockchain, the Polygon zkEVM network, and various supernets. The upgrade also prepares for future milestones in the Polygon 2.0 roadmap, such as the launch of a new staking layer, upgrade to zkRollup, and implementation of an advanced interoperability and shared liquidity protocol. The migration of MATIC to POL token began in September with the release of three Polygon Improvement Proposals (PIPs).

The seed round will accelerate production and deployment across various ecosystems, with a focus on legal work and integrations with wallets, payment companies, and other strategic partners.

title: Where to Buy Ethereum PoW (ETHW) Crypto: Beginner's Guide 2023 - Blockonomi
summary:

Ethereum, the second-biggest crypto blockchain project in the world, recently concluded the process of combining the proof-of-work platform with the Beacon Chain called The Merge. As a result, Ethereum has moved from being a highly carbon-intensive platform into a clean proof-of-stake (POS) network. While many developers have welcomed the shift, some believe that proof-of-work (PoW) is a more secure platform. This led to the creation of the Ethereum Proof-of-Work, otherwise known as Ethereum PoW. This article discusses where and how to buy the ETHW crypto token.

Key takeaways:

* Ethereum PoW is a clone of the proof-of-work blockchain used by the Ethereum network before the switch to a proof-of-stake consensus algorithm.
* The platform preserves the functionality of the Ethereum network before its switch to PoS.

title: Ethereum Network Gas Fees Drop to New Low Due to Declining Activity in DeFi and NFTs - Bitcoinsensus
summary: Ethereum gas fees hit a historic low of 8.8 Gwei on Oct 8, 2023, driven by reduced engagement in DeFi, NFTs, layer-2 networks, and Telegram bots. This led to a shift from a deflationary to an inflationary state for Ethereum, with the supply of ETH increasing at a daily rate of 1,450 ETH. The drop in gas fees also had a broader impact on the Ethereum ecosystem, with top gas spenders spending 30% less and NFT trading volumes dropping to levels not seen in two years.
